title: [IOTDB-3505] Fix NPE when regionCleaner deletes schema regions after restart.
body:
_deletedRegionSet_  is not cleared but the schema regions has been deleted  because client is closed accidently. And When do deletion again, NPE occurs.

After fixed, deleted schemaRegions are skipped:

2022-06-16 19:38:14,758 [pool-1-IoTDB-InternalServiceRPC-Client-4] WARN o.a.i.d.m.s.SchemaEngine:334 - SchemaRegion(id = SchemaRegion[0]) has been deleted, skiped 
2022-06-16 19:38:14,758 [pool-1-IoTDB-InternalServiceRPC-Client-4] WARN o.a.i.d.m.s.SchemaEngine:334 - SchemaRegion(id = SchemaRegion[26]) has been deleted, skiped

title: [IOTDB-3438] Fix empty WAL file
body: The empty wal file is produced by wal delete thread when dataregion's memtables are all flushed. To avoid this, wal delete thread will only roll wal file when wal file is not empty.

title: [IOTDB-3510] Read/Write Routing policy (Routing to DataNode with the lowest-loaded)
body:
**New feature:** Add RouteBalancer into LoadManager. The RouteBalancer constructs the IRouter to generate the current optimal real-time routing policy for read/write requests. IRouter based on loadScore has been implemented. See **LoadManager, RouteBalancer, IRoute and LoadScoreGreedyRouter** for more details.

**Code refactoring:** For PartitionTable queries in ConfigNode, the last level of mapping result is only to TConsensusGroupId. In order to correspond to the current DataNode's interfaces, ConfigManager will map the TConsensusGroupId to the TRegionReplicaSet. Since this

title: Fix the issues in LocalSinkHandle/LocalSourceHandle
body:
## Description
The issues are:
1. If the LocalSourceHandle only need part of TsBlocks from upstream, its onFinished method won't be triggered
**Solution**: Remove `isFinish()` judgement before invoking `onFinish()` inside setNoMoreTsBlock
1. Even if TsBlock inside `ShareTsBlockQueue` is still not consumed up, the `ShareTsBlockQueue` may be destroyed by SourceHandle but the 
**Solution**: The queue is only be destroyed when the LocalSourceHandle and LocalSinkHandle are both finished.
3. LocalSourceHandle's `finish()` won't be triggered in some scenario. 
**Solution**: Invoking LocalSourceHandle's finish() when the SharedTsBlockQueue is set to NoMoreTsBlock

title: Improve auto create schema
body:
## Description


### Motivation

The old implementation of fetching timeseries, which don't exist, takes two RPC——auto create and refetch, which is not that efficient.

### Modification

Use the TSStatus to return created schema info, and this helps avoid the refetch operation and reduce RPC.

The process follows the steps:
1. Try fetch schema that the data insertion need.
2. Generate the schema info of missing timeseries and try auto create
3. The timeseries may be concurrent created by other thread or task. Return the already existing series info.
4. Merge the generated schema info and returned existing schema info to construct the final auto create result.

title: [IOTDB-3456] Optimize PathPattarnTree for improving write performance
body:
see [IOTDB-3456](https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/IOTDB/issues/IOTDB-3456)

1. Removed all constructors with parameters. When using PathPatternTree, we need to create an empty Tree and append the paths one by one.
    ```java
    PathPatternTree pathPatternTree = new PathPatternTree();
    for (String measurement : createAlignedTimeSeriesStatement.getMeasurements()) {
        pathPatternTree.appendFullPath(
            createAlignedTimeSeriesStatement.getDevicePath(), measurement);
    }
    ```
2. Support two interfaces in PathPatternTree, letting the checking in the query not impact write performance.
For write: `appendFullPath(PartialPath devicePath, String measurement)`
For query: `appendPathPattern(PartialPath pathPattern)`
3. Unify the naming style of querying methods.
    ```java
    findAllDevicePaths -> getAllDevicePatterns
    splitToPathList  -> getAllPathPatterns
    findOverlappedPaths  -> getOverlappedPathPatterns
    ```

title: [IOTDB-3491] Assign an unique id to each ConfigNode
body:
ConfigNode does not have an index, the output ConfigNode id of the show cluster command is arbitrary:
![fcdfa6edbee95dc7c58ceb131b29818](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33111881/173588961-8b085886-e8da-47ff-b872-54e2518971e7.png)

Therefore I assign an unique id to each ConfigNode after the new ConfigNode is applied.

Start three ConfigNodes and then three Datanodes. The result of show cluster is as follows:
![3efec31abc0e9f8b1ad05a52a9b7a75](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33111881/173588242-cd432eb6-e8f2-4aec-9136-25176553681a.png)
  
Start ConfigNode and DataNode alternately, and the result of show cluster is as follows:
![2bb34c9d9b743196e5a6387d14d328d](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33111881/173588368-1ff9fe16-80f3-447b-b515-7830fd6179cd.png)

title: [IOTDB-3182] Judge DataNode status through heartbeat(Simple version)
body:
Temporary, we judge the DataNode's running status and load score by the following simple logic:

1. If the ConfigNode-leader doesn't receive any heartbeat from a DataNode within **20 seconds**, that DataNode is considered faulty and its status is set to Unknown.
2. Cluster read/write requests are always sent to the DataNode with the lowest load score. We currently believe that the newer the received heartbeat sample is,  the lower the load score is.

title: [IOTDB-3490] Eliminate LocalConfigNode Usage in New Cluster
body:
## Description

### Motivation
The localConfigNode is unnecessary to be initialized in cluster mode.

The old implementation of SchemaEngine Recovery is based on ```StorageGroupSchemaManager```, which coupled it with the LocalConfigNode Recovery. 

The mlog force depends on the timed thread in LocalConfigNode.

### Modification

Replace the ```StorageGroupSchemaManager``` in SchemaEngine with an individual ```MTreeAboveSG```, which is used for the prefix share of schemaRegions.

Add a timedMLogForceThread to SchemaEngine, which enables the schemaEngine to force schemaRegions' mlogs.

After the modification, SchemaEngine can be used without LocalConfigNode in new Cluster.

- WAL-delete: From abort to continuously.

title: Fix missing import in DataPartition
body: ## Description

title: [IOTDB-3439] Move Setting up RPC Service to the last step of starting DataNode
body:
1. 启动 InternalService (`prepareJoinCluster()`)

2. DataNode 本地 setup (`active()`)

   *  SchemaEngine 根据本地 data/system/schema 目录获得sg名和regionId，恢复 SchemaRegion
   *  StorageEngine 根据本地 data/system/storage_group 目录获得sg名和regionId，恢复 DataRegion
   *  DataNode 根据 data/system/schema/system.properties 恢复DataNodeID
   *  根据共识组日志恢复 Region 共识组
   *  恢复并启动其他IService

3. DataNode 向 ConfigNode 汇报本地状态并注册（`joinCluster()`）

   * DataNode首先需要成功连接上config node集群
     1. 根据iotdb-engine.properties读取配置文件中的target config node，连接target config node进行注册。
     2. 若连接失败，则根据data/system/schema/system.properties读取持久化的confignode list，尝试进行连接。（data/system/schema/system.properties中的config node list会在每次confignode-datanode心跳时更新，进行持久化）
     3. 若能成功连接上config node，则无论注册成功与否，config node都会返回完整的config node list给datanode，datanode在内存中保存config node list。若连接失败，datanode 启动失败

   * 通过 registerDataNode 接口向 ConfigNode 发送
     *  TDataNodeLocation
     *  DataNodeID （重启时获取，新的DataNode不存在）
     *  Map<存储组、DataRegion信息>
     *  Map<存储组、SchemaRegion信息>
   * ConfigNode返回注册结果
     * Global config。
     * Confignode list

4. ConfigNode 针对 DataNode 状态进行处理

   * 判断 DataNode 是否已经在集群中
   * 检查 DataNode Region 信息是否和 ConfigNode 中一致

5. 启动 RPC Service （`setUpRPCService()`）

[IoTDB-3437]Skip RegionReplicaSet in serialization of Fragment Instance
body:

title: Try fix Concurrent Bug

title: Make New Cluter CI stable
[IoTDB-3308] Fix the issue that NPE will be threw when query the series with no data
body: ## Description Currently, if a query contains some series which has no data, it will throw NPE when doing the distribution planning. It is because that there is no DataRegion is allocated for the series with no data. And thus we cannot do the distribution planning for it because it doesn't belong to any existed data region. To solve this issue, we defined a mock DataRegion named `NOT_ASSIGNED`. When doing distribution planning, the node with that no-data series will be marked as `NOT_ASSIGNED`. And the real data region it runs will be its parent's read data region. If its parent's data region is also `NOT_ASSIGNED`, we will select the data region of the parent of its parent... If the `root` of the PlanNode tree is also `NOT_ASSIGNED`, that means all the series related to this query have no data and the query will be skipped after analyzing. See the snapshot below. （`roog.sg1.d3.s1` has no data）
